intro: Chiococca floridana, commonly known as Florida chiococca, is a rare flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered white or pink flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as swamps and riverbanks. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a glossy texture. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and is protected in several conservation programs.
